instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-00165 dropping voltage on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
Board had very small liquid damage around U7100.

PPDCIN_G3H is dropping to around 5V then spike to 8V-11V and drop within a few seconds to 5V and spike again.
Replaced U7100 just in case but still same results.
Tested with a few DC boards.

Same voltage results on fuse on DC board.
When DC board is not connected to the main logic board voltage is correct and stable.

Any ideas guys?

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-00165 dropping voltage on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 from U7000???

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-00165 dropping voltage on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
What? How is a dead U7100 (NOT U7000) causing the pin 27/28 wrong reading?????

This is just a corroded resistor R7121/22 or the traces between them and U7100/R7120

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-00165 dropping voltage on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
It was corroded R7180.
Problem solved - many thanks for help.
